summary: Congress created Opportunity Zones to spur investment in distressed communities. About 10% of Americans live in the nearly 9,000 zones. In these areas, certain business investments can bring significant tax benefits to the investor. Unlike other, similar tax incentives, there is no limit on the amounts investors can claim for tax breaks. But how will opportunity zone investments actually affect these communities? Congress should consider...
title: Opportunity Zones: Improved Oversight Needed to Evaluate Tax Expenditure Performance
